column4: is ubuntu blocking any ports? cause opening ports in my router doesn't do anything
try installing firestarter and open the port for bittorent
where can I define ports in firestarter?
In 'Allow Service' right click and say 'Add Rule'
the port is still closed (atleast according to www.canyouseeme.org)
that didn't help, port is still closed
are you sure ubuntu itself isn't blocking ports too?
If they are opened up in firestarter then they should not be blocking
well then it just might be a problem with my router I'll check, thanks
It is core of a system which is a layer between user applications and hardware resources.
